page.title: 02THE POLICE STATION
page.content: P.C. Ryan, has been at the police station for 29 years, and he said that everything is changing. The summer figures are higher than the winter ones for arrests, because in the summer, more tourists come. They have 2 cells, made of hard wood. Eight policemen work at the station. At the moment they have no prisoners. The police keep track of everything going on in the district, with computers. There are training courses for two years to see who will get into the force. Sometimes on a call for help, they have to travel as far as Ilford. The Chief Inspecter of the whole force is Sir Kenneth Newman.The wages vary. P.C. Ryan thinks that the area is good for work because it has a good variety.He is a gardener and a horse rider in his spare time.The main crime is theft and burglaries.
